StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genetics of Human Developmental Brain Disorders

Person.Organization: HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOLBETH ISRAEL DEACONESS MEDICAL CENTERBOSTON CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding for generating this data was provided to Christopher A. Walsh at Boston Children's Hospital by the NINDS (R01NS035129), Howard Hughes Medical Institute, Dubai Harvard Foundation for Medical Research, and Qatar National Research Fund (a member of The Qatar Foundation) (NPRP 5-175-3-051). We thank the Broad Institute for generating high-quality sequence data supported by NHGRI funds (U54 HG003067) with Eric Lander as PI. The datasets used for the manuscript were obtained from dbGaP at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap through dbGaP accession number phs00492.v2.p1.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Epilepsy and Cognition, PUB, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-EAC-PUB-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Epilepsy and Cognition. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
Limited to study of genetic causes of human neurological disorders of epilepsy and cognition. This includes disorders of brain formation such as microcephaly (small brain), lissencephaly (smooth brain), and polymicrogyria (too many small folds in the brain surface), disorders of brain function such as intellectual disability and autism, and other related conditions.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Microcephaly-Micromelia Syndrome, PUB, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-MMS-PUB-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Microcephaly-Micromelia Syndrome. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Polymicrogyria, PUB, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PM-PUB-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Polymicrogyria. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (PUB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-PUB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genetics of Human Developmental Brain Disorders

Person.Organization: ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI

ConsentGroup.title: Human Epilepsy and Cognition
ConsentGroup.name: HEC
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Limited to study of genetic causes of human epilepsy and cognition. This includes disorders of brain formation such as microcephaly (small brain), lissencephaly (smooth brain), and polymicrogyria (too many small folds in the brain surface), disorders of brain function such as mental retardation and autism, and other related conditions.
